name: Meat Lite: Spicy Cashew Pork
description: Editor's note: Philadelphia food writers Joy Manning and Tara Mataraza Desmond drop by each week with Meat Lite, which celebrates meat in moderation. Meat Lite was inspired by the book coauthored by the two, Almost Meatless, due out in spring...
recipeIngredient: 3 scallions, green and white parts sliced and separated
1 tablespoon tamarind concentrate or tamarind paste
1 1/2 cups stock or broth (chicken, pork, vegetable or mushroom)
1/2 cup cashews (roasted and salted or raw--whichever you prefer), roughly chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oil in large sauté pan over medium-high heat. Add the pork and cook to brown the meat, about 5 minutes. While the pork browns, break it into small pieces with a wooden spoon. Add the sliced white parts of the scallions and the garlic, and sauté for about 30 seconds. Add the carrot and bok choy, and stir fry the vegetables and aromatics for about 1 minute.
Whisk together the sugar, miso paste, tamarind concentrate, stock and lime juice. Pour over the vegetables and pork. Simmer for 10 to 15 minutes until the liquid thickens.
Add the green parts of the scallions and the chopped cashews. Serve over cooked rice or rice noodles.
